ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: If you could smoke freely, would you like a cigarette this minute?
Notes: 1= Very Definitively; 2 = Definitively; 3 = Probably; 4 = Possibly; 5 = Probably Not; 6 = Definitively Not; 7 = Very Definitively Not; 888= N/A; 999= missing data

ElementDescription: Do you have an urge to make a cigarette now?
Notes: 1= Very Definitively; 2 = Definitively; 3 = Probably; 4 = Possibly; 5 = Probably Not; 6 = Definitively Not; 7 = Very Definitively Not; 888= N/A; 999= missing data
1= Very Definitively; 2 = Definitively; 3 = Probably; 4 = Possibly; 5 = Probably Not; 6 = Definitively Not; 7 = Very Definitively Not; 888= N/A; 999= missing data

ElementDescription: Are you thinking of cigarettes more than usual?
Notes: 1= Very Definitively; 2 = Definitively; 3 = Probably; 4 = Possibly; 5 = Probably Not; 6 = Definitively Not; 7 = Very Definitively Not; 888= N/A; 999= missing data

ElementDescription: Would you find a cigarette unpleasant right now?
Notes: 1= Very Definitively; 2 = Definitively; 3 = Probably; 4 = Possibly; 5 = Probably Not; 6 = Definitively Not; 7 = Very Definitively Not; 888= N/A; 999= missing data

ElementDescription: If you were permitted to smoke, would you refuse a cigarette right now?
Notes: 1= Very Definitively; 2 = Definitively; 3 = Probably; 4 = Possibly; 5 = Probably Not; 6 = Definitively Not; 7 = Very Definitively Not; 888= N/A; 999= missing data

ElementDescription: Smoking a cigarette would not be pleasant
